intro: Hippia bogotensis, commonly known as the Bogotá orchid, is a flowering plant native to the Andean region of Colombia. It is a member of the Orchidaceae family and is characterized by its terrestrial growth habit and epiphytic tendencies. The plant typically features dark green, strap-like leaves and produces small, fragrant flowers in shades of white and pale yellow. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in cloud forests. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
